name: Klemens Strasser
bio: Klemens is a indie developer dedicated to crafting delightful apps with a strong focus on accessibility. He won an Apple Design Award as a Student in 2015 for his very first project, Elementary Minute. In 2025, his latest app, Art of Fauna, received both an Apple Design Award and an App Store Award. His work centers on creating thoughtful, high-quality experiences that are welcoming and usable for as many people as possible.

name: Yasuhiro Inami
bio:
Inamiy is an iOS developer at Goodnotes, focusing on mobile app development and AI-powered features.
He is a big fan of functional programming including Swift, Haskell, and any statically typed languages that can check his bad code.
Nowadays, he has shifted toward compiler-like work that helps detect and correct poor code produced by AI.

name: Joannis Orlandos
bio: Joannis Orlandos is a cross-platform Swift developer and member of both the Swift Server Workgroup and Swift Android Workgroup. He announced the official Swift SDK for Android on Swift.org and co-founded Wendy Labs, creators of WendyOS—a Swift-first Linux distribution for embedded devices. Joannis maintains Hummingbird 2, created MongoKitten and Citadel, and co-runs SwiftOnServer.com

name: Yuta Koshizawa
bio: Yuta is a software engineer specializing in iOS, Swift, and real-time image recognition. He is the author of “Heart of Swift,” a widely read online Swift book in Japan. He also regularly hosts an online study group called “Swift Zoomin’”.
